title: What makes Google so low?
text:
Google consistently posts massive profits and yet its PE is around 20, which is much lower than other big tech names that sit at 40+, Tesla with a PE near 180, and PLTR up in the 600s.  
  
If we go by valuation multiples alone, Google should easily be trading above $380. What's happening?
author: u/sedate_matron

quality_issues: Off-topic content: The signal is primarily focused on financial valuation and investor perception, which is distinct from general consumer sentiment or product-related brand perception.

Misclassification of signal topic: The provided metadata 'topic: Google Product Leaks and Rumors' is entirely inaccurate for the signal text, which discusses stock valuation. This indicates a significant upstream data quality issue.
quality.recommendations: Implement more granular topic classification for incoming signals to accurately distinguish between financial discussions (e.g., stock performance, valuation) and consumer/product-related brand perception. This will ensure signals are correctly routed and interpreted by downstream models like Agent B, preventing misattribution or dilution of relevant perception data. Evaluate whether investor sentiment and financial performance are intended components of 'brand perception' for Agent B; if so, define how these signals should be categorized and utilized.

title: Why is Google so low?
text:
Google makes more profit than any company and has PE 20 while other mag 7 stocks have 40+. Even Tesla goes up everyday with its ridiculous PE 185, and PLTR with PE 699.

Google should be at least $384/share if it trades like other stocks. What's holding it down?
author: u/DryGeneral990

quality_issues: Mismatched metadata: The 'topic' field provided ('Google Product Leaks and Rumors') is entirely misaligned with the actual content of the signal, which discusses Google's stock valuation and investor sentiment.
quality.recommendations: Implement robust topic modeling or classification to ensure metadata like 'topic' accurately reflects the signal's content. Inaccurate categorization can lead to misdirection in forecasting models. Clarify the scope of 'brand perception' for Agent B: specifically, whether investor sentiment regarding financial performance should be included in or separated from general consumer sentiment analysis. If investor sentiment is out of scope, a filtering mechanism for such signals might be beneficial.

title: My current DeGoogle+ journey
text:
Originally a text post bc my phone has Olauncher so there's no icons there, I decided to make a simple visual while also including the things I've done on my PC to move away from Google and equally bad corporations.

I know there's a couple of interesting choices here like Ecosia over the more popular stuff, if you have any questions (including about things I haven't changed) feel free to ask!

Original post, with some extra info:

Windows -> PopOS (linux)

Gmail\* + Outlook -> Tutamail

Samsung calendar -> Tuta calendar

Google Drive -> kDrive (waiting to see if Tuta Drive has a free plan)

Google Authenticator -> Aegis

Samsung Keyboard -> Heliboard

Google Maps -> OsmAnd

Office + Google docs + Canva -> Libreoffice + Cryptpad

Photoshop -> Krita

Samsung Notes -> Standard Notes

Play Store -> Droid-ify + Aurora Store

Firefox -> Mullvad Browser (PC) / Ecosia Browser (Android)

Password Manager of my browsers -> Bitwarden

DuckDuckGo -> Ecosia search engine (looking for green alternatives)

Samsung Calculator -> Fossify Calculator

X\* -> Bluesky

Whatsapp Desktop - > Beeper

Youtube -> Freetube (PC) / NewPipe (Android)

Instagram -> QUIT

Facebook -> QUIT

Reddit -> Lemmy (pending while I figure how to navigate the fediverse)

TikTok -> QUIT

Pinterest -> QUIT

DeepL -> LibreTranslate

Streaming services (Netflix, Prime Video) -> Physical media + Piracy



Also a list of things i'd like to change but currently can't.

Android: Have yet to find an alternative OS compatible with my Galaxy Note20 (OPEN TO SUGESTIONS)

WhatsApp: Would lose contact with friends and family, would love to use Signal.

Discord: Would lose contact with friends, would love to use Matrix

Gmail: Jobd demand Gmail. Can never truly quit.

YT Music: My family pays it. Don't want to throw away money on another platform when I already have one here. I would like to use Quobuz.

X: Not enough people are using alternatives, this is my main place to keep up with news of projects I like, would love to delete it and just use bsky and the fediverse

Amazon Shopping: Is there even another place to buy stuff internationally? (I'm from LATAM)

Twitch: Alternatives are equally ass (to my knowledge)

Steam: Want to move away from this monopoly and actually own the games I buy (DRM-free). Costs money to rebuild but I'm looking at Gog and buying physical games on a console
author: u/Freladdy11

quality.recommendations: This signal is exceptionally valuable for brand perception forecasting. Agent B should be configured to: 1. Perform multi-brand sentiment analysis on this signal, as it contains explicit negative sentiment and stated reasons for dissatisfaction/switching regarding numerous major brands (e.g., Google, Samsung, Microsoft, Amazon, Steam, various social media and streaming services). 2. Leverage the specific reasons for switching (e.g., 'monopoly', 'DRM-free', 'bad corporations', privacy concerns, desire for open source/green alternatives) to identify underlying drivers of brand perception shifts. 3. Analyze the 'things I'd like to change but currently can't' section as indicators of significant pain points and latent demand for alternatives for brands like WhatsApp, Discord, Gmail, X, Amazon, Twitch, and Steam.

quality_issues: Content too short to be meaningful
Poor metadata classification (Incorrect topic assigned)
Lack of contextual detail
quality.recommendations: Prioritize signals that include more extensive text content (e.g., body of the post, comments) for richer context. Improve the accuracy of topic classification to ensure signals are correctly categorized (e.g., assign 'Google Translate' or 'Google Products' as a topic). If the original source is an image (as suggested by the URL), implement OCR or image description to extract more textual information.

title: 5 file management apps you should use instead of Files by Google
text: Files by Google is a great file management app for basic tasks, but if you need something more powerful consider these alternatives.
author: Andy Walker

quality_issues: Poor sentiment indicators (too neutral/ambiguous)
Misleading or oversimplified sentiment information
quality.recommendations: Implement more sophisticated sentiment analysis capable of detecting nuanced, mixed, or conditional sentiment (e.g., 'good for basic tasks, but insufficient for powerful ones'). The current 'POSITIVE' label is an oversimplification. Future signals should also be enriched with tags for competitive comparison or feature-gap identification.

title: Sam Altman’s Prediction : ChatGPT 5 Will Create First $1 Billion One-Person Company
text: What if the next billion-dollar company didn’t need a sprawling office, a massive team, or even a traditional CEO? Imagine a single entrepreneur, armed with nothing but a laptop and innovative AI tools, building an empire that rivals the giants of Silicon Val…
author: Julian Horsey

quality_issues: Misleading or false information: The 'topic' metadata field ('Google Collaborations and Partnerships') is incorrect and contradicts the signal text, which is focused on ChatGPT/OpenAI.
quality.recommendations: Implement a more accurate topic extraction or verification mechanism to ensure metadata (e.g., 'topic') correctly reflects the content of the signal text. This mismatch can lead to miscategorization and erroneous trend analysis by Agent B.

title: Google Finance redesign goes all in on AI, complete with a chatbot
text: The Google Finance web app is getting a major overhaul with an emphasis on AI. This redesign includes an AI-powered chatbot, which will answer finance-based queries and provide relevant links. Here’s hoping the chatbot will keep hallucinations to a minimum, g…
author: Stefan

quality.recommendations: This is a high-quality signal for brand perception analysis. Agent B should specifically track mentions of 'AI hallucinations' or similar accuracy concerns related to Google's AI chatbot across various sources post-launch. This signal provides an excellent early indicator of a potential risk factor for Google's brand perception in the context of AI integration. It can be used to establish a baseline for sentiment around this feature's introduction and monitor subsequent shifts.

title: Kid Maroon Collection Gets A 50,000 Print Run From Vault Comics
text: The current Kid Maroon series by Christopher Cantwell and Victor Santos published by Vault Comics will get a 50,000 print run for its collection, published at the end of September, far more than the individual issues sold, for the tale of the 12-year-old chil…
author: Rich Johnston

quality_issues: Poor sentiment indicators: The provided sentiment label 'NEGATIVE' contradicts the positive implication of the signal text (a 50,000 print run, 'far more than the individual issues sold', typically indicates success or high demand).
Misleading or false information: The sentiment label is misleading given the content of the signal.
Off-topic metadata: The 'topic: Google Product Leaks and Rumors' is incorrect for content about comic book publishing.
quality.recommendations: Review and recalibrate the sentiment analysis model, especially for signals indicating product performance or market expectations (e.g., print runs, sales figures), as a higher print run generally indicates positive perception. Ensure consistency between the extracted sentiment and the content's inherent meaning to prevent misleading signals for perception forecasting. Additionally, verify the accuracy of topic classification for incoming signals.

quality.recommendations: The primary signal text is empty, making it completely unusable for perception forecasting. It is critical to ensure that the `SIGNAL TEXT TO EVALUATE` field is correctly populated with the actual text content. Based on the `ADDITIONAL CONTEXT`, the intended signal appears to be the `full_text` from the Twitter post: 'This week at Google, we shared updates to learning tools in Gemini and a new feature called Storybook. https://t.co/ZHbgP2sbDA'. This content, if provided, would allow for meaningful evaluation and analysis, unlike the current empty string.

result.text:
In June, we launched Gemini CLI, an open-source AI agent that brings the power of Gemini to your terminal. Now, we’re introducing Gemini CLI GitHub Actions.

It’s a powerful AI coding teammate for your repository, created for team collaboration on the platform where developers work with each other. It’s now available on GitHub in beta to everyone worldwide at no cost.

quality_issues: Incoherent content

quality.recommendations: The provided 'SIGNAL TEXT TO EVALUATE' is empty. For effective time-series analysis and perception forecasting, the signal text must contain meaningful content, such as social media posts, news articles, or other textual data directly related to brand perception. Ensure the source system correctly populates the signal field with the actual content to be analyzed, rather than providing an empty string and requiring data extraction from separate context.

result.text:
Here are new @GeminiApp tools to help you learn, understand and study better this school year ✏️

- Guided Learning helps you build a deep understanding of subjects, with step-by-step breakdowns that uncover the “why” and “how”
- Gemini’s responses automatically integrate visuals, like diagrams and YouTube videos, so you can understand more easily
- Flashcards and study guides based on Gemini-generated quizzes or other class materials let you review key concepts 

Plus, students can get a Google AI Pro subscription at no cost for 1 year, available in the U.S., Japan, Indonesia, Korea and Brazil. 

Learn more about @GeminiApp’s latest updates → https://t.co/IYi4Ns1Nvk

media.ext_alt_text: A side-by-side comparison of two Gemini AI versions. The "Before" version instantly solves a physics problem for a user, providing all calculations and the final answer. The "After" version, labeled "Guided Learning in Gemini," engages the user in a step-by-step tutorial. It breaks down the problem, explains concepts like kinetic and potential energy, and prompts the user to recall formulas and solve the problem themselves, acting as a tutor rather than an answer key.

A side-by-side comparison of two Gemini AI versions. The "Before" version instantly solves a physics problem for a user, providing all calculations and the final answer. The "After" version, labeled "Guided Learning in Gemini," engages the user in a step-by-step tutorial. It breaks down the problem, explains concepts like kinetic and potential energy, and prompts the user to recall formulas and solve the problem themselves, acting as a tutor rather than an answer key.

quality_issues: Content too short to be meaningful
Incoherent content (empty signal)
Off-topic content unrelated to brand perception (cannot be related when empty)
Overly generic statements with no specific brand insight (provides no insight)
Poor sentiment indicators (no content for sentiment extraction)
quality.recommendations: The 'SIGNAL TEXT TO EVALUATE' field is empty. For Agent B to effectively analyze sentiment trends, train ML models, and forecast brand perception, it requires actual text content. The full text of the tweet, which contains highly relevant brand communication (e.g., 'Here are new @GeminiApp tools to help you learn, understand and study better this school year...'), is present in the 'note_tweet.note_tweet_results.result.text' or 'legacy.full_text' fields within the 'ADDITIONAL CONTEXT'. This text should be extracted and populated into the 'SIGNAL TEXT TO EVALUATE' field to provide a meaningful and actionable signal.

We're also committing $1 billion to AI literacy, research and more over the next 3 years → https://t.co/MDoQQO1zCn

quality_issues: The automated sentiment labeling provided with the signal appears to misinterpret the brand's positive initiative as neutral, suggesting a potential limitation in the sentiment extraction model's ability to capture nuanced brand perception from official announcements.
quality.recommendations: The signal itself is of high quality for perception forecasting. For Agent B, it is recommended to review and refine the sentiment analysis model's ability to interpret positive brand initiatives, commitments, and news announcements, as the current model classified this inherently positive content as neutral with low confidence. This refinement would allow for a more accurate reflection of the immediate and potential long-term positive impact on brand perception.

legacy.full_text: We’re making our most advanced AI tools and training programs free for 1 year for every college student in America. Learn more and sign up by October 6th, 2025. Terms apply.

quality_issues: Content too short to be meaningful
Overly generic statements with no specific brand insight
Poor sentiment indicators (too neutral/ambiguous)
Spam, gibberish, or incoherent content
quality.recommendations: The 'SIGNAL TEXT TO EVALUATE' is empty. This indicates a critical failure in the signal generation or extraction process. For Agent B (Perception Forecaster) to function accurately, it requires high-quality, actionable text signals. An empty string provides no information, no sentiment, and no insight. The system responsible for populating this 'SIGNAL TEXT TO EVALUATE' field must be debugged to correctly extract relevant textual content (e.g., the 'full_text' field found in the 'ADDITIONAL CONTEXT IN RELATION TO SIGNAL' section) from the raw data source.
